results.title: Julia: critical moments in teaching (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Don G. Williams, David Gliessman, United States. Dept. of Health, Education and Welfare and Calvin Productions
results.brief_description: Julia, a naturally retiring child, becomes withdrawn in class. The school psychologist tests her and finds she has a hearing impairment. He recommends keeping Julia in her present class. Her teacher is suddenly confronted with the realisation that she has primary responsibility for Julia’s education. What steps should she take to help her?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don G. Williams, David Gliessman, United States. Dept. of Health, Education and Welfare and Calvin Productions

results.title: Julia the gourdcarver: Peru
results.creator_credit: Paul Saltzman and Sunrise Films Ltd
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
Four thousand years ago in the high mountains of the Andes, the Inca Indians began carving gourds to record their legends and history. Today Julia Sanabria, 11 years old, continues the ancient craft taught by her uncle. She carves her own life story on a gourd and takes it to the market town of Huancayo. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Jules Verne's mysterious island; Marco Polo
results.creator_credit: Leif Gram, Walter J Hucker and Air Programs International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Storytime Collection”.
Features two classic children’s stories; JULES VERNE’S MYSTERIOUS ISLAND; five prisoners flee the American Civil War in a hot air balloon. They land on a mysterious island, blown by the storm winds across the Pacific Ocean. What is the cause of the inexplicable events that occur on the island and will the five prisoners live to find out? MARCO POLO; set in China in the year 1260, this animated production is based on the original Marco Polo journals. Marco Polo and his servant Ton-Ton travel from Venice to China on a mission to find the Kubla Khan.

results.title: Jules Verne
results.brief_description:
Jules Verne had three passions in life: the sea, music and freedom. The passion for the sea started during his childhood in Nantes, in the Quartier de l’Ile Feydeau, filled with memeories of explorers and slave traders. Destined to become a lawyer, Verne is sent to Paris where he begins to write. His writings are highly influenced by the industrial revolution and the belief in the power of the machine to transform the world.

Credits: Director, Jean Vidal ; writer, Yolande Cassin.
Cast: Daniel Ivernel [narration only].

results.title: Jules et Jim = Jules and Jim (Cinemascope Print)
results.creator_credit: Francois Truffaut, SEDIF and Les Films du Carrosse
results.brief_description:
The story of a menage-a-trois in the years around World War I is distanced by the narrator who makes the viewer continually aware of the artifice involved in its telling. Truffaut drew on incidents in his own life in developing Roche’s novel in a personal way. He identified Jim with Roche and Jules with himself. Their discovery of Catherine is symptomatic of the confusion between art and life which pervades the protagonists’ lives. The narrative, punctuated by cinematic allusions, is marked by a wide range of techniques and rapid shifts in mood from pathos to whimsy. Also avaiable on VHS and laserdisc.

Credits: Director, Francois Truffaut ; writer, Francois Truffaut, Jean Gruault ; photography, Raoul Coutard ; music, Georges Delerue ; editor, Claudine Bouche.
Cast: Jeanne Moreau, Oscar Werner, Henri Serre, Marie Dubois.

results.title: Judy Maddigan
results.creator_credit: ACMI, Lisetta Moscardo and Helen Simondson
results.brief_description: Judy Maddigan was the first woman Deputy Speaker and was the first woman to be appointed the Speaker of The Legislative Assembly in Victoria in 2003. Maddigan has a strong commitment to community and was elected as a Member of Parliament to represent the Electoral District of Essendon in the Legislative Assembly in 1996. During her time as speaker Maddigan implemented many changes in the 150 year old parliament to improve the lives of workers and also public accessibility. She is a librarian at heart and is currently the Member for Essendon.
